message: summary of Access Control Policy & Procedure
response: The Access Control Policy & Procedure (v1.2, Doc. no. JMBGRP/ISMS/Pol-AC) aims to protect organizational resources from unauthorized access while enabling legitimate use.  It applies to all employees, business owners, custodians, system administrators, software developers, users, outsourcing partners, consultants, and trainees.  The policy states that systems may need stricter or looser controls based on risk assessment, with reasons for deviations documented.  Each application/module needs a System Owner to conduct risk assessments, specify access requirements, and monitor implementation.  Physical security controls must meet business needs, deter breaches, and avoid disrupting business processes.  The policy addresses perimeter security (personnel and technical controls), surveillance (site selection, rationale, operational and maintenance procedures), and access control mechanisms.
